inn1.comm: starts over the wicket, ambles in and pitches it up outside off... and Roy carves it to backward point first ball! Roy maybe thought it would come back in at him, so played fractionally inside, thick, low edge went flying straight into the safe hands of Guptill. Well, England's plan was to be more attacking...
slightly full, around the line of off, Root gently leans into a push through the covers for a couple
fullish, looking for inswing that hasn't yet materialised, lets this one go
pitched up on the stumps, shaping a touch on leg, closes the face and takes two more through backward square
on the pads again, flicked in the air... and just wide of leg gully! McCullum had a man placed there but it flew just out of reach

full outside off and Hales punches it crisply back down the ground, looks like four all the way as it races past mid-off but B-Mac never gives up the chase and hurls himself after the ball to fingertip it back from the rope. Brilliant work
full of a length around the line of off stump and punched back to the bowler coming forwards
slightly full, this time defended softly back to the bowler
bit of width and Hales frees the arms and cracks four through point, powerfully struck and there's no one out there to cut it off
touch straighter from Henry, on middle and leg and worked off the pads
beautiful stroke, four more for Hales! Pitched up on middle and off, Hales shuffles into line and laces it down the ground, easy on-drive, lovely balance and it skips away
length outside off, shaping back a touch as Hales shoulders arms
good length, pushed across the batsman from over the wicket, Root raises his bat out of the way
fractionally wider, 83mph but not much lateral movement for Boult so far, another  leave
another boundary for England, nicely punched off the back foot, free swing of the arms through the drive and he finds the gap left for him in the covers
length around off stump, gets on top of it in defence

driven on the up, gets it past mid-off, that's going to the fence as well... Nicely played by Root, walking out to strike precisely down the ground. England have got their rocket-boosters working after all
moves across and shoulders arms, tight line outside off but judged it well
in the channel, good length delivery not doing much off the straight, Hales lets it through
angled in with the arm, plays across the line and works one to deep square leg
flicked off the body, gets it through a gap at midwicket, sitting back in the crease and using Henry's pace to deflect a couple

superb timing from Root, driven off the back foot, not particularly short or wide but cracked through the covers once again, right up on his tip-toes, outruns the chasing fielders. England's fifth boundary of the innings
shortish, again punched off the back foot, brilliantly fielded by the diving Guptill at backward point
back of a length on the stumps, nudged down the leg side for a single
bowling around the wicket, angled in on the stumps, works across the line for one out to deep midwicket
tossed up, drifting outside off stump, leans into a defensive push to cover
flighted, on leg stump, closes the face and ticks one more through square
flat offbreak on middle stump, punched back to the bowler
quicker delivery, on the stumps and whipped away with a turn of the wrists through midwicket
tossed up on off stump, Hales presents it a solid straight bat in defence
goes around the wicket, pitched up and driven firmly back, Boult sticks out his left hand to stop it
touch short of a length outside off, sits in the crease and runs one to third man
drops short and there's width for Hales but he only manages to toe-end a cut to the man at cover
length ball, coming in at Hales who goes hard at it, gets a thick outside edge that flies wide of slip and then beats third man, too
fuller, outside the line of off, Hales goes for another big boomer, gets an inside edge on to his pads
short and wide again, this time Hales drives with a flourish but can't get it through point
flat around the line of off stump, Root uses his feet and chips the ball down the ground, no one out there and it bounces away to the rope
on the stumps, worked across the line into the leg side
drags his length down a touch, pulled hard from outside off stump, mid-on gets a hand to it but they pick up two more
slightly short again, drops back and chops one through the covers
tossed up, Root comes forward and pushes into a gap into the off side for another single
flat on the stumps and Hales taps it back to the bowler
continues around the wicket, angled in and Root stays back to run one down to third man

short ball, Hales tries to pull from outside off, it goes high but not far... and Henry takes the catch running back at backward square leg! One ball after the 50 partnership, Hales gets a bit too flap happy and falls for a run-a-ball 20. Still looking for a substantial innings in ODI cricket. Decent surprise bouncer from Boult
shortish and wide of the stumps, thinks about playing but holds his bat inside at the last moment
fuller, tempting the drive and Root bites, swing and a miss
bit of width, cut off the back foot, struck firmly but Guptill again earns his corn at backward point
switches to back over the wicket, fullish in the channel, Root gets forward and lets this one go
slightly back of a length, Morgan punches towards mid-off and sets off before aborting the call, Root has to scramble but gets back in time as the throw comes in
on the stumps, worked to mid-on from the crease
touch back of a length, around off stump, dabbed into the covers
some width, shortish again, Morgan goes deep and cuts the ball hard but straight to backward point
pitched up around the line of off and neatly driven, fine of mid-off, McCullum chases it down and Morgan gets off the mark with a couple
shortish on the hips, flicked down towards fine leg, slightly to the fielder's left and they come back for two
around the wicket, back of a length, there's the timing and placement again from Root, picks the gap through the covers for two more
lovely stroke, on to the front foot and pinged past mid-off, McCullum was desperately trying to cut it off but the ball zoomed away to his left
straightens his line, wristy flick through midwicket for a single
over the wicket, goodish length outside off, Morgan dabs it down coming forwards
skips forward and pushes at a length ball on the up, gets a inside edge through square and there's a big open space for them to rack up three in
full and angled across, Root spears four more through point, he's batting on a cloud out there
good length, outside the line of off, lets this one fly through
skips forward and dabs a quick single into the covers
banged in and rising, waaaaaaaaaaaaay over the batsman's head
back of a length in the channel, waits in the crease and steers through cover point
short, not all that much room but Morgan manufactures a cut, finds backward point
Morgan starts to come and Henry drops short, 86mph and prodded into the ground towards point
back of a length and punched wide of mid-off, this time he'll get a single

dollies it up on off stump and Morgan steps out, pumps him into the stands! Welcome back to the attack, Nathan... Step, step, boom, straight down the ground and sailing into the second tier of the stand. That went miles
flatter, on the stumps and pushed down the ground towards long-on this time
floated up outside off, Root reverses the hands, manages to squeeze one away towards short third man
still around the wicket, tossed up and Morgan skips out and drives through the covers
backs away, McCullum follows him, blocked into the off side
backs to the leg side again, McCullum fires it in and this is pushed back to the bowler
short and Root attempts to pull, comes off the back of the bat and then his shoulder, I think, rolls square
full on the stumps, closes the face and works it away fine, they get back for a second
short ball, drops back and nudges to the on side
on the stumps, Morgan shuffles forwards and flicks away through midwicket for a couple
full outside off, Morgan steps out and drills it firmly past mid-off, on the walk but they have to run their runs, as mid-off prevents four
length ball around off stump, works across the line and takes a single into the leg side
length delivery, skidding on outside off, drops back and punches towards long-on
quicker, on the stumps as Morgan comes forwards, drives down the ground to long-on
darted full outside off stump, 59mph, opens the face and steers in front of square
Morgan jumps to the leg side, flat and quick from McCullum, mistimes a cut towards cover
coming forward again, fired in towards the feet, gets a bit of dip and Morgan only succeeds in bunting it into his boot, quickly regains his ground as Ronchi fields
flat trajectory outside off, drops back and scythes one away through point
over the wicket, back of a length outside off, cut hard and it flies past the diving backward point, there's cover out there
steams in and lets out a grunt as a short ball pins Root back in the crease, defended down into the turf

length delivery, nibbles across Root, who fends away from his body, gets a thick edge but it sails between keeper and slip, neither went for it and that's fifty for Root. Frustration for McClenaghan, Ross Taylor was perhaps a little wide and it went right between the two
back of a length and sliding down the leg side
shortish, outside off, drops back and steers towards point
another grunt from Mitch, short of a length, 84mph, dabbed square
off-stump line, touch short and Root back-cuts late down to third man for a single
goes to sweep from well outside off, parried by midwicket, they still get the single
steps outside leg and lifts a length ball over extra-cover, been looking for that and here nails it, top shot
stays in the crease this time and pressed out to deep cover
swept from outside off again and this time Root gets all of it, up and over midwicket, sails back over the rope, great timing
goes again, this time the man at long-on is interested going to his left but he drops a vry tough chance with one hand reaching down to his right, Root gets away with it
steps down the wicket and flicks this back to the bowler
good length just outside off, this is dabbed out towards point
wider line, Morgan ran down the wicket to it, tried to drive and got a thick inside edge that ran into midwicket for a quick single
back of a length, Root swivels on a pull and finds deep square
fourth-stump line on a length, this is pressed to extra-cover
wide outside off, Morgan cuts at it, misses but this is called wide which is a little harsh for me
this time gets the cut away but it's too close to third man to consider a second
another pull out to deep square for a single
full length on the stumps, this is flicked out wide of deep square and they get a couple
straighter line, tries to drive down the ground but gets an inside edge into the pad that runs to midwicket
hangs back here and punches down to long-on
around the wicket, oh shot again from Morgan, freeing up the off side and swings through the line from off stump, it sails back over long-off, nailed the timing
just pats this back to the bowler
more of a length ball and just defended again
length ball sliding across the right-hander, Root stays leg side of it and guides it wide of third man, his timing today has been awesome
tighter line and Root drives up to extra-cover
short ball, Root pulls from head height, controlled stroke but too close to deep square for the second
full length at the middle and leg stumps, this is dabbed up on the leg side and they sprint a couple, excellent running
length a foot wide of off stump and left alone
charges down, bowler responds with the bumper and Morgan pulls out of the stroke
length ball drifts into the pads, Root plays the most delicate of leg glances and it runs very fine for four more
stays back when he could have been forward, almost caught out but pushes this to midwicket
finds the same fielder, this with a drive off the front foot
hangs back and late cuts but with no real pace to work with only finds short third man
step down the pitch and whacks this to long-on
gives himself room leg side but the bowler followed him and this is just tapped back to the bowler
back of a length, pulled out through midwicket, great timing once more
another pull, this just rolls out to deep square
tight line on a length, Morgan blocks in the crease out on the off side
similar delivery, this is blocked out to extra-cover

length ball wide of off stump, Morgan runs at it and has to reach out for this and gets a thick top edge that whirls down towards third man but over his head! Pretty lucky but brings the hundred stand up in 84 balls
more conventional cut this time, finds deep point
length on off stump, Morgan trying to force off the back foot gets an inside edge up the wicket
straighter line and pulled but only down to long leg for a single
full length at the pads, this is clipped down to the right-hander's long leg
back punching to long-on to bring a fifty up in 45 balls
down the track and lifts this into the sightscreen over the bowler's head, another superb shot from Root, into the 90s now
length ball, this is clipped down to long leg for just a single
full length a foot wide of off stump, this is dug out to backward point
good length on off stump, Root presses forward and finds extra-cover
bit of width and Root carves it wide of third man, finding the gaps so well today
tries again but this time steers it straight to third man

full length angled in, Morgan is caught on the crease and misses, an appeal for lbw and given out! by umpire Gough. Morgan considers before going for a review but this looks dead. He hasn't hit it, and Hawk Eye has three reds so a good decision from the umpire and McClenaghan makes the breakthrough. Sliding one into Morgan who slightly fell over the stroke looking to clip to leg, caught below the knee roll bang in front
full length around off stump, this is played back up to the bowler

full length, Root nudges this down the ground, inside mid-on and this runs away for the two runs to bring up Root's century from just 71 balls, what a fine innings this has been, superb batting, England's third-fastest ODI century
not as full and this is blocked up towards mid-on
touch straighter and finds midwicket this time
back foot punch to cover point
not that short but Root rocks back and pulls wide of deep midwicket, not right off the meat but enough bat to beat the fielder
this is off the meat but an on-drive only finds the fielder, Root is disappointed with himself
clip wide of mid-on and they get three as two fielders chase back towards the rope
back-foot punch into the covers

runs down the wicket, leans out to drive outside off and nicks to the keeper! The change works and Boult brings to an end a superb innings from Root. Leaning across to meet this, wasn't in control and got a thin edge behind
length ball a foot outside off, this is blocked out into the covers
tad fuller, this is a firm drive out to deep cover
full length just outside off, this is firmly punched to the bowler who gets down low to ensure no runs are scored
full length floated up on middle and leg, this is clipped out through midwicket
length just outside off, this is played back to the bowler
goes for the reverse sweep to a similar ball and times it well enough wide and over short third-man, risky but got away with it pretty well
fuller and this is driven back to the bowler
gets this past the bowler and inside mid-off so they can sneak a quick single
similar delivery, Root drives down to long-off
around the wicket, full and wide of off stump, this is left alone
tighter line, this is pressed off the back foot out to deep cover
over the wicket and wide of the crease, length just outside off, Stokes plays a firm drive off the back foot to mid-off
very full at the pads, Stokes misses trying to flick to leg
very full again, this time dug out into midwicket
touch too full now, this is worked down to long leg
full length around off stump, this is flicked down to long leg
nudged back to the bowler this time
forward again, finding the bowler once more
stays leg side of this is and lifts it smartly over the in-field and wide of long-off for three
delicate touch down the leg side but too close to short long leg
flicks leg side, firmly and in the air but this lands short of midwicket
very full just outside off, this is driven to deep cover

short outside off, Stokes goes to pull and drags it into his stumps. He was early on the shot and got a thick bottom edge that deflected into his leg and then the off stump, Stokes is furious with himself and charges off the ground. Boult strikes again, he now has four, but this is a complete bonus
back of a length just outside off, this is dabbed down towards point
very full now, Billings tries to dig it out into the covers and plays and misses
drives this just wide of mid-off for a quick single
length a foot wide of off stump, this is dropped down to third man
delicately touched to short long leg, they take on the fielder and get home easily
step down the track, meets this on the full and plays wide of mid-on for a quick single
lands this, but on a full length and this is played down to long-off for a single to bring the 200 up
foot outside off, dabs this out through midwicket
punched from the crease down to long-on

goes to flick leg side and misses, struck on the pad and there's a loud cry for lbw, Bruce Oxenford says not out but New Zealand want a review and fair enough because it looked close. Has it straightened enough? Oxenford might have though it was sliding down leg, no bat involved and Hawk Eye has this going on to strike middle stump, absolutely stone dead, the technology does it's job and England lose another. A first wicket from Mitchell Santner on debut
length delivery in the channel outside off, Buttler lets it go
straighter line, moves across and deflects the ball to midwicket
pitched up in the channel, reaches out and cracks a couple through the covers, firmly struck
good length, 83mph and shaping back a touch, Buttler watches it by once more
slightly short and wide, Buttler hangs back and cuts but can't get it past backward point
little bit of width, Buttler stays in the crease and steers towards backward point again
tossed up on middle and off, defended to the leg side
gives it some air, Rashid comes forward and drives crisply but the ball is cut off at extra cover
floated up, moves on to the front foot and flicks wristily through midwicket to get off the mark
length outside off, drops back and defends
tossed up, around the line of off, Buttler chops one more through the off side
floated up wide of the stumps, nice and enticing, Rashid is tempted and goes hard at it, thick edge but it squirts wide of slip and runs away to the boundary
low full toss and it's crumped through the covers, in front of the sweeper for a couple
short ball this time, Buttler sways back and guides wide of third man for two more
touch short outside off, opens the face and glides a single behind square
pitched up around off, Rashid opens up his stance and punches through the covers
goes back over the wicket, full and slightly wide, driven along the carpet to deep extra cover
pitched up wide of the stumps, 83mph, Rashid flails at it, gets a toe end down to third man
tossed up and pushes back down the track
makes room, Santner tosses it up on the stumps, cuts late but can't get it past backward point
shorter length as Rashid comes forward, dabbed to the off side
outside off, touch short and cut hard again but finds the fielder
gets hold of this one, away over long-on for a Dorothy! Used the feet again, out to the pitch and launched it down the ground
flat on the stumps and whipped to the leg side
back of a length outside off, sits in the crease and guides it down to third man
around the wicket, short again and Buttler defends this on the back foot
goes full and draws a loose drive from Buttler, no foot movement and it takes the edge but there's only one slip in and it flies low, wide of the Taylor, runs away to the fence
tighter to the off stump, defended from the crease
touch short and wide, 84mph and Buttler tries to cut, gets an under-edge through to Ronchi on the bounce
dug in at the batsman, rolls the wrists on a pull wide of fine leg for a couple
flighted, on middle stump, Rashid skips out and drills a drive back to the bowler
slightly short and wide, slapped through the covers off the back foot, Boult reels it in just before the rope
full toss on off stump, bunted through the covers to the man in the deep
flat outside off, short enough to cut but can't force it through the infield
drops a little short and this is windmilled away over midwicket for four more to Rashid, touch of the Dhonis about that, backing away and muscling over the ring
on the stumps, tapped calmly back into the off side
sprayed full and wide of the tramlines
slightly full and Buttler walks out to meet it, crunches a low drive past the deep extra cover sweeper for four. That raced off the bat
comes forward and pushes through the off side for one
banged in short and Rashid swats it away, in the air for a while before bouncing down to the man at fine leg
edged... and four! Keeper and slip bisected again, Taylor is standing very wide. Not sure you could call it deliberate but Buttler opened the face and managed to get it through by luck or judgement
bit of width and Buttler spears the ball behind square, well stopped by backward point
short and at the body, Buttler nurdles away via his thigh pad through square - that's the 50 stand between these two
tossed up and walloped into the stands, clean swing through the line and Buttler serves up six over long-on
flatter, outside off, punched through the covers coming forwards
pushed through on off stump, steers another single through the off side
full and straight and flipped for six, one step to clear the front leg and then comes the saucepan through the line, impudent straight hit from Rashid
flatter, outside off, steered to backward point
on the stumps, slightly short and Rashid now rocks back and cracks a flat pull through midwicket - four more, Edgbaston is bouncing again, 19 runs off the over
oof, not sure what that's hit but it can't have been comfortable... tried to scoop a length ball from outside off but took his eye off it in ducking and wore it on the body
sliced away and wide of third man, chunky swing of the bat and that takes Buttler to his fifty from 42 deliveries
pitched up and punched through the covers coming forwards, in front of the sweeper
fast hands and that's pulled for four more, nonchalant stuff from Buttler, sitting back in the crease and hammering a short ball through backward square
pitched up full outside off, goes hard at it, flayed over point and a fumble from the man in the deep brings them back for a second
full length outside off and driven, this time to the man at cover
over the wicket, short and at the top of Rashid's bonce, pulled down through square for one
back of a length outside off, slapped through the covers to the man in the deep
extraordinary shot, in the air but gets it wide of mid-on, Henry dropped short and Rashid tried to pull from outside off - looked like a jumping forehand smash, very nearly got him out
shuffles across and steered through the covers
length ball in the channel, goes for a big drive but gets an inside edge
touch short, on the stumps, Rashid wheels around and hoicks one through backward square leg
plays from the crease and flicks this to midwicket
wide of the midwicket who saves well with a dive but can't prevent the single
full length around off, this is pressed up to mid-off
off stump line and this is reverse-swept with great timing past short third man
dragged down the leg side, swung at and missed
slight bit of width outside off and Buttler strokes a glorious lofted drive over long-off, beautiful from Buttler, 300 up
tucks this out wide of deep midwicket and they come jollying back for the second
clears the front leg and belts a length ball straight to mid-off

back of a length and pulled, Rashid got plenty on it wide of mid-on and it skips out towards the boundary, the fielder just hauls it in in time but they're running three and they will check the run out. Looks like the bowler's hand has broken the stumps so even though Rashid is a foot short of his ground, it's not out, missed chance there for New Zealand in the end
only just back of a length and Buttler whacks it over midwicket, such power
cutting this time, gets it wide of the cover sweeper so they charge back for two more
wide line outside off, Buttler was playing over the top of it, outside the guideline but a fair enough call not to wide that
cut again, this time straight to extra-cover and Buttler is a little perturbed that he didn't do better there
flicks this down the leg side just for a single out to deep square
steps outside leg and meets this on the full, can only find mid-off
and again, straight to the fielder
finally pierces the gap, it was a full toss just outside off, good timing past mid-off
finds the cover fence now, stepping to leg and cutting through the in-field, timed so well again
dragged down but this is pulled only as far as deep square
length ball well wide of off stump but right on the guideline
touch wider and now this is penalised
back on off stump, this is whacked leg side, deep midwicket is under this but drops the chance! Ross Taylor down low, actually couldn't quite get there in time and it squirmed under him for four too
short ball outside off is now called wide
manages to steer this wide of mid-off, in the air, but safe and it skips away for a couple
length ball just outside off, Rashid looks to bash it down the ground but finds mid-off
gets this wide of mid-off this time, in the air but safe and it skips away for a couple
stays leg side of this and goes to carve backward of square but misses
full on the stumps, Buttler goes for a scoop and pulls it off superbly, delicately tapped very fine, no fielder out there
full just outside off and Buttler drives it past extra-cover with excellent timing, there's the hundred! 66 balls, what a superb innings this has been
wide slower ball, driven at, gets a thick inside edge that runs through square leg for a single
back of a length outside off, Rashid reaches out for it and slaps it over mid-off, or does he? Dropped by Nathan McCullum running back, tough chance
slaps this out through midwicket now for a steady single into the deep
backs away and punches off the back foot to deep cover
slower ball wide of off stump, reached for and gets it up to mid-off
tighter line, this is slapped towards mid-on who gets across to save well
back of a length, Rashid onto it quickly and whacks it through square leg, nice controlled pull, fifty for Rashid in 37 balls
pulled again, this time straight to mid-on
even short just outside off, tried to be uppercut and missed
goes for another pull and gets a thick top edge over the keeper's head
full length ball just outside off, Buttler swings his hands through the line and times another sailing back over long-off
low full toss, Buttler only finds deep midwicket
slower ball on the stumps, looks to whack this leg side but gets it off the toe to mid-on
full outside off and this is four more, another drive between mid-off and extra-cover
slower ball, this is dragged leg side wide of deep midwicket and they scamper back for the second
full on the leg stump, this is whipped leg side wide of long leg, four more!
full just outside off, reached for and tapped up to mid-off, they sprint a quick single
full around off, Buttler just swings through the line and once again smacks it into the crowd, no foot movement, just all hands and manages it time it that well

back of a length, Buttler whacks it leg side but doesn't get this at all and chips a catch to square leg who takes it well tumbling back. Having to reach outside off and above his head here, couldn't control the stroke at all and got a top edge that looped to the fielder. What an innings from Buttler, very very special
similar ball, Rashid manages to get on top of this and steers this wide of long leg for a couple
finds the gap now and belts this between long-on and deep midwicket, timed very well and picks the gap superbly
yorker, haven't seen too many of those today, digs this out back to the bowler
full on middle and leg, Jordan aims leg side but it comes off the pad to short third man
sensibly bunts this down the ground for a single
leans down to sweep and only gets it to square leg, they race a single
steps to leg and drives a full ball out to deep cover
down the track and whacks this wide of long-off, brings up England's highest total in ODIs, gave himself just enough room
full tight delivery, this is squeezed out to point they race a single
full length just outside off, this is driven out to deep cover just a single

swing at a length ball just outside off, gets a thick outside edge that loops to short third man. Reaching for it outside off, it comes off a whirl of a top edge straight to the fielder, they did manage to cross
slower ball on the stumps, aims leg side but whacks it straight to deep midwicket. A superb effort from Rashid too here but picks out the deep fielder, just didn't get the elevation
low full toss and smashed down the ground for six! 400 for the first time in an ODI in England and the most sixes in an innings from England too
slower ball but wide of off stump and called wide
slower ball on the stumps, Plunkett onto it straight away and heaves it over midwicket, creamed it
nice finish from the bowler, yorker on the stumps, dug out down the ground for just a single

inn2.comm: full on the stumps, this is whipped straight to midwicket
off stump this time, this is nudged wide of mid-off and they take a sharp single to get the chase underway
down the track first ball, this comes off a thick edge down to long leg, they charge back for the second and a direct hit from the boundary forces a check upstairs but McCullum is back safe
slightly back of a length and this is wheeled wide of long leg
width outside off and McCullum hammers it over cover, nailed it

down the track again, swing and a miss and bowled him! Finn roars his delight as he pegs back the off stump, revenge? Perhaps not quite but a fillip for Finn nevertheless, that is a huge breakthrough so early in the chase. A wild swing from McCullum aiming down the ground, he misses and the off stump went back
full length a foot wide of the off stump and left alone
fuller length and this is a powerful drive through cover, timed well
strikes the pad with Guptill going a little across his stumps, too leg side for the appeal
brings one back a little from outside off to take a thin inside edge but it lands just short of the keeper
wider line and this is another nice drive through cover point, can't give opportunities to free the arms
another inside edge, this into the thigh pad that runs out towards point
full at the pads, this is tucked to square leg
good length a foot outside off, this is tapped down towards mid-off
slides this back into the pads, Williamson misses looking to touch this into the leg side, comes off the pad to square leg
full length just outside off, this is dug out towards mid-on
off stump line, blocked back from the crease to the bowler
back of a length just outside off, goes to pull and misses
length ball on a straight line, flicks the thigh pad and loops wide of square leg for an extra
touch straight and this is clipped down fine of long leg, Finn scrambles well to his right and they get back for a third
good length at the pads, this is squirted out through square leg
good length around off, Williamson just blocking to mid-on
this comes back and takes the thigh pad, second slip diving to his right saves the leg bye
fuller length and a touch straight, Williamson finally off the mark with a clip past midwicket
full at the pads, this is clipped down to long leg
slightly back of a length and Guptlll pulls very smartly through backward square leg, really well timed and controlled
goes for another pull but gets this off the toe of the bat to mid-on
more runs through square leg, this a front foot flick and timed very well again
back on a fourth-stump line and this is blocked out into the covers
touch wider, tries to force off the back foot but mistimes this to cover
good length around off stump, this is dabbed out from the crease into the covers
touch fuller, a bigger stride out to defend into the covers here
similar ball, manages to almost drop this at his feet and they charge through for a single
fuller length and Williamson times a lovely straight drive back past the bowler, perfect timing, driven on the up
not as full and just defended this time out into the covers
tad wider line and driven at, this comes off a thick inside edge that flies past the off stump and wide of Buttler diving to his left
gives himself a bit of room outside off and biffs this over extra-cover, length ball on off stump and this is just whacked away, so harsh on the bowlers
down the ground this time, not timed but it evades mid-on running back, going for the lofted straight drive was Guptill and he nearly paid the penalty

steps to leg again, goes to swing another away and nicks behind! Quite a wild swipe and a thin edge to Buttler. Guptill got away with it previously but not now. Gave himself some room again to try and smash another length ball away, this from off stump, but here could only give a catch to Buttler and England have now removed both dangermen
length at the stumps, this is tucked backward of square and Taylor is away immediately
length on a fourth-stump line, this is blocked back to the bowler
wider line and this is dropped down to third man
driven in the air from outside off but gets it wide of a diving mid-off and away for four
tighter line and this is blocked on the front foot
tad wider and dabbed out into the covers now
too straight and this takes a tickle very fine down the leg side, flies away
straight drive now, bisects the two silly fielders and takes a single inside mid-on
touch straight again and this is flicked down to long leg for an easy single
good length around middle, Taylor turns this to midwicket
foot outside off, this is dropped out into the covers
back of a length and pulled, thick bottom edge and it's not very far away from the off stump, runs to Buttler
fuller length and this time pushed up from the crease to mid-off
similar length, just a tad wider and this is eased into the covers
shorter again and pulled again, comes off a thick top edge that flies very fine, one bounce over the rope
good length just outside off, this is defended forward back to the bowler
wider line and Williamson gets a thick underedge looking to force out on the off side
straighter line and this is whipped out wide of deep midwicket for a well-run two
back on a length, back around off, this is nudged back to the bowler
tad fuller so driven but comes off a thick inside edge to silly mid-on
wider line and swiped at but missed
very full, this is dug out on the leg side and runs up to mid-on
on a length now and this is squeezed out through square leg for a single
a hint of shape into the right-hander, haven't seen any swing all day, takes inside edge via the pad up on the leg side
fuller and Willamson strokes a lovely straight drive back past the bowler, very straight and very well timed, in the air but safe
length a foot outside off now, pressed to cover
in the air again but once more down the ground away from the fielders and it's four more, inside mid-off this time, punching through the line
full ball on the stumps, pushed back up past the bowler for a single
length just outside off, this is cracked out to deep cover
leg side line, this is paddled up on the leg side for an easy single
down the track and has to stretch for a ball outside off and gets there to time a lofted drive over mid-off, nicely timed
leg stump line, delicately turned around the corner, just for a single
full length on middle and leg, this is nudged back to the bowler
full length on the stumps, this is clipped out wide of deep square who does well and prevents the second
good length on off stump, defended in the crease back up to the bowler
tad shorter and pulled in the leg side, doesn't get all of it and it lands well short of the deep square running to his left
very full just outside off, this is driven out to deep cover
length a foot wide of off stump, this is guided down to third man
tighter line and this is pressed back to the bowler again
down the track driving into the off side, extra-cover slides to his right and keeps them down to just one
also down the wicket, chips this in the air slightly but wide of the bowler and they take a quick single inside mid-on
tries to come down again, Rashid drops is a little shorter and Williamson has to adjust to play out to backward point
playing from the crease, clips this straight delivery to mid-on

down the track again and Williamson tries to swing this down the ground, gets it low off the bat and high in the sky, nowhere near enough bat on it and Joe Root sprints in from long-off to take the catch and Rashid strikes. Mentioned it was a good chance for him with the batsman having to force the pace and so it has proved with Williamson holing out here
slides this into the pads, this is glances down fine of deep square and they get back for a second
full ball slips this down leg
length around off stump, blocked back to the bowler
similar delivery, blocked out to extra-cover this time
shorter and wide enough to cut, well struck and wide of gully, flashing past the fielder to the boundary
fuller length and Elliott is feeling for this just outside off and plays and misses
fuller again and this time driven steadily up past extra-cover for a couple
length ball just outside off, left alone, it comes back a little but not enough to trouble off stump
floated up towards leg stump, Taylor goes down on one knee and paddles one around the corner
length delivery on middle and leg, worked along the carpet to midwicket
tossed up, around off stump, leans out and punches a couple through the covers
loopy delivery outside off, maybe a googly as it takes the inside edge with Elliott trying to drive, squirts through backward square leg
this comes out as a full toss, reaches forward and bunts one past short extra cover
tossed up nice and slow, around off stump, Taylor walks down the pitch and works to the leg side
length ball on the stumps, closes the face and turns into the leg side
touch short, outside the line of off, drops back and steers the ball to backward point
very full, almost a leg-stump yorker, 86mph and clips the pad, rolls towards fine leg... would have missed the timber
bouncer from Plunkett, and it's a good one, Elliott takes his eye off the ball and wears it on the shoulder, trying to duck
on the stumps, back of a length and worked behind square on the leg side
slightly short and wide of the stumps, mistimes a cut through the covers for a single
tossed up and straightening a fraction on leg stump, pushed back to the bowler
flighted, drifting towards leg stump and there's turn, Taylor sweeps and is hit on the pad... Gough turns the appeal down, probably pitched outside leg and they decide not to review
very slow, looped outside off, pushed into the covers
full toss, on the stumps and clubbed through midwicket, into the deep for a couple
length ball, drops back outside off and steers it square
tossed up on the stumps, plants the front foot and drives, straight to extra cover who throws to Buttler with Elliott wandering out of his crease... but he gets back in time
on the stumps, full of a length and glanced through square
length delivery, sliding down the leg side
on the stumps, good length, closes the face and works it through midwicket for one
in the channel, pulled off a length and gets it wide of mid-on, whiff of the farmyard about that but it was hit prertty cleanly and it runs away

steps out and heaves this over cow corner for six! If he didn't like the first one Plunkett will be even less pleased about this... Swung high and beyond the rope, a favourite Taylor blow. Back-to-back boundaries breaks a brief drought
digs this in short, gets the pull down but not past midwicket
clips this off the pads through square
floated up on leg stump, nudged towards mid-on
skips out to meet a full delivery and drives, in the air for a fraction of a second but drops short of Rashid
tossed up on middle and leg, pushed towards midwicket
plants the front foot with bat next to pad and squeezes the ball out defensively
drives, slices the shot as it grips and turns a fraction, but the ball sails wide of the scrambling fielder at backward point
lovely bowling, does him with the googly, back through the gate and over the top of off stump... Unlucky not to strike, bounced a bit too much
length outside off and guided off the back foot, well stopped by Roy at backward point
tip and run into the covers, takes on the fielder and the throw is just wide of the stumps at the non-striker's end
fullish, straying towards leg stump, flicks at it and misses but they run a leg bye
touch full, tight line and pushed back past the bowler along the ground, mid-on cleans up
shortish, pulled hard and flat but in the air - just short of Hales at deep square leg, who puts in a magnificent diving effort, manages to stop the ball bouncing past him, too
clubbed down the ground, that's a meaty stroke from Taylor, too full and he stepped across, carted it through long-on to finish the over well
nurdled away through square leg for a couple
tossed up on middle and off, Elliott prods it back down the track
length ball on the stumps, pushed back on the leg side, slightly in the air but it falls safely
pushed through outside off stump, Taylor drops back to cut but finds backward point
drifted towards leg stump, Taylor goes after him and lofts over mid-on, was playing across the line but he got a clean strike through the ball, Stokes couldn't reel it in on the boundary
slower still, extra bounce and it hits the splice as Taylor presses forwards
full outside off and Elliott drives along the ground towards mid-off... where Morgan misses it completely, the ball bobbling away off his boot and to the fence
on the stumps, fullish and worked around the corner through backward square leg
cheekily done from Taylor, spotted fine leg was up and shifted across, played a little dab-cum-sweep past the man on the edge of the ring for four
full and straight, punched down the ground for one - half-century from Taylor, going along nicely in the evening sunshine
length ball on off stump, defended with a straight bat
banged in short, Elliott was moving to the leg side, decided not to play... probably should have been wide on height

outside off and guided down to third man... easy single but Elliott wants two, Billings' throw comes in and England think they have him! Yes, that is a fine bit of work in the field and NZ are four down, Elliott several inches shy of his ground as Buttler collected and broke the bails
tossed up very full, shuffles forwards and pushes in front of mid-on, Stokes hurls at the stumps but Taylor makes his ground
long hop from Rashid but Santner can only whack it straight to extra cover
tossed up on leg stump from over the wicket, nudged into a gap on the leg side
flighted, around off stump, drops back and guides one behind square
gives it some air, straightening on leg stump, shows it a straight bat
leg-stump line, maybe the googly this time, comes forward to defend again
down the leg side, wobbles a bit and Buttler can't collect it cleanly
beauty from Stokes, good length around off stump and beats the outside edge as Santner pushes forwards
pitched up on the stumps and blocked into the ground towards mid-on
length in the channel, tight line from Stokes, driven into the covers on the back foot
touch short, over the top of off stump, dead-batted back down the track
attempted yorker, I think, 87mph but it comes out as a full toss, clubbed straight to mid-on and Santner has to quickly regain his ground
on the stumps, touch full and worked wide of mid-on this time, they take one and Santner will keep the strike
nicely bowled, googly from Rashid, beats Santner's bat as he hangs back in the crease
pushed across from over the wicket, quite wide, swing and miss this time
tossed up on middle and leg, gets out to this and chips over mid-on for a couple
beaten on the inside, spin for Rashid and it hits the thigh pad as Santner comes forward
drops a little short, googly sits up and is spanked through the covers, first boundary for the new New Zealand No. 6
on the stumps, worked towards midwicket for a single
back of a length outside off stump, drops back and steers one in front of square
slower ball from Stokes, on off stump, closes the face and nudges short on the leg side, comfortable single
good length in the channel, tentative prod-and-a-miss from Santner
shortish, 87mph and climbing outside off, chopped behind the diving backward point for one to third man
fullish on off stump, works across the line, into a gap at midwicket, misfield brings them two
another slower ball, short outside off, rolling the fingers over it, Taylor swats it between point and extra cover with a horizontal blade
flighted but drifting down the leg side and left alone
length delivery straightening on off stump, drops back and dabs one through backward point
fizzed up on leg stump and spinning, hits the pad... legbreak beats Santner's swipe
comes forward and lofts down the ground, hits through the line and that will be four, bouncing away safely to the rope
tossed up, advances again, chips it towards mid-on but lands short as Rashid calls "catch!"

googly, tossed up outside off, goes back to cut - and edges to slip! Rashid has got him, smartly taken by Jordan as he anticipated the shot and went to his left. Slightly laborious innings from the debutant Santner

although not when he's in the hutch, Rashid gets his third, bowled first ball! Another googly, right on the spot as Ronchi tried to slog-sweep his first ball, there was a big gap for the ball to go through and it thudded into off stump
pitched up, towards leg stump and Taylor is flicked on the pad, Finn appeals for lbw but was heading down... and the ball heads down to long leg
fired down the leg side, this one's wide

full and straight again, Taylor plays across the line, misses... and this time Finn's appeal succeeds! Taylor review, which he has to as the last recognised batsman, but loses a tight call on the DRS, with Hawk-Eye saying it would have just clipped leg. So England get the man they wanted, NZ seven down now and in need of miracles (plural)
bouncer, outside off stump, Henry pulls and misses
back of a length, pokes at it and gets an inside edge down on to his pads
length ball just outside off, Henry tries to force away on the off side from the crease and misses
tad fuller and this is played forward and defended
tossed up wide of off stump, this spins away but is left alone
low full toss just outside off, this is driven past mid-off
straighter line, McCullum across his stumps tucking this up on the leg side
throws the hands at this outside off, wild outside edge but it lands short of backward point

googly into the front pad, beats the inside edge, appeal for lbw and given out! No reviews left so Henry has to go and another change-up has worked. This has spun quite a long way but is perhaps going down? Either way the umpire gave it out so bye bye Henry and New Zealand are sinking quickly here. Hawk Eye indeed had that sliding down leg
low full toss, clipped out through midwicket
full just outside off, swing and a miss
this is at the stumps, blocked out from the crease into the covers
similar area, dabbed up back to the bowler from the crease
tad shorter, forced out into the covers up on his toes
full ball slips down the leg side
back on a fourth-stump line, this is pressed out to extra-cover

fuller length, pushed at just outside off and edged to second slip! A dolly, especially for Jordan, although he did actually slip this slightly but held on either way. Another for Finn who has enjoyed a good day. Goes fuller, bringing the batsman forward, he was a touch late on the stroke and got a thick edge straight to the fielder at waist height

full just outside off, McClenaghan swings at this and gets it in the air out to deep midwicket who takes the catch! And England have wrapped up a mighty victory here. Hiding to nothing for McClenaghan, taking a swing, getting it off a thickish inside edge and Hales took the catch a yard in from the rope in front of a joyous Eric Hollies Stand
